page.title: 01MORETON-IN-MARSH,GLOS.
page.content: Moreton is situated in the extreme N.E.of Gloucestershire. The Four Shires Boundary Stone is 3 km away. Although Moreton has grown during the last 30 years because a number of housing estates have been built, it is still a village.The village centre and the Fire College occupy 4 sq.km. of the block,the rest being agricultural. The{population}in 1981 was 2500. The tree-lined High Street was once the Roman road,the Fosse Way. Occasionally excessive water from Bourton-on-the- Hill caused{flooding.}Recently the drainage systems have been improved. Moreton still has a{Railway Station thanks to the efforts of The Cotswold Line Promotion Group, who have opposed attempts by British Rail to close the line. The line goes west to Worcester and east, via Oxford, to Paddington, London, all trains stop at Moreton.
